name: AD LDAP
description: App specifically designed for interacting with Microsoft Active Directory's LDAP Implementation

server.description: The Active Directory Server hostname, IP, or VIP for binding

username.description: The username with which to bind to LDAP

password.description: The password for the binding user

force_ssl.description: Force the use of SSL protocol. Note that some actions are not possible without secure binding!

validate_ssl_cert.description: Select if you want to validate the LDAP SSL certificate

ssl_port.description: The port to bind for SSL (default 636)

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Adds one or more Active Directory objects to one or more groups

use_samaccountname.description: Specify members AND groups as sAMAccountName(s) instead of distinguishedName(s) (note: member AND groups will use sAMAccountName if selected)

members.description: Semi-colon (';') separated list of users. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then these must be distinguishedName(s)

groups.description: Semi-colon (';') separated list of groups to which the members will be added. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then these must be distinguishedName(s)

actions.description: Removes one or more Active Directory objects from one or more groups

use_samaccountname.description: Specify members AND groups as sAMAccountName(s) instead of distinguishedName(s)

members.description: Semi-colon (';') separated list of users. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then these must be distinguishedName(s)

groups.description: Semi-colon (';') separated list of groups from which the members will be removed. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then these must be distinguishedName(s)

actions.description: Unlocks a locked Active Directory account

use_samaccountname.description: Use sAMAccountName for user instead of distinguishedName(s)

user.description: Specify the user to unlock. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then this must be the user's distinguishedName
Specify the user to disable. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then this must be the user's distinguishedName

actions.description: Enables a disabled Active Directory account

user.description: Specify the user to enable. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then this must be the user's distinguishedName

actions.description: Resets the password of a user, requiring the user to change password at next login

user.description: User whose attributes are to be modified
Specify the user whose password will be set. If 'use samaccountname' is false, then this must be the user's distinguishedName

actions.description: Moves an entry in Active Directory

destination_ou.description: The distinguishedName of the OU the specified object will move to

actions.verbose: This action flexibly supports querying Active Directory using LDAP syntax.

filter.description: The LDAP filter (must be in LDAP Syntax)

search_base.description: The search base to use in its distinguishedName format. If not specified, the 'defaultNamingContext' will be used

attributes.description: Semi-colon separated list of attributes to collect (e.g. sAMAccountName;mail)

actions.verbose: This action takes any number of principals (sAMAccountName, distinguishedName, or userprincipalname) and returns requested attributes. Separate with semi-colon (';').

principals.description: The semi-colon separated principals. These can be sAMAccountName, userprincipalname, or distinguishedName

attributes.description: Semi-colon separated list of attributes to collect

actions.description: Add, delete, or replace an attribute of a user

user.description: User whose attributes are to be modified

action.description: Semi-colon separated list of attributes to collect

actions.verbose: When 'use_samaccountname' is false, the object parameter should include the distinguishedName. Otherwise, use the sAMAccountName. For the 'new_name' parameter, append the attribute to the desired name. For example, to rename a user, use 'cn=New_user_name'; for an OU, use 'ou=New_OU_name'.
